___procedure.description: An array of "subprocedure" objects representing the steps to be executed on the robot

___flow-rate.description: Flow rate for aspirate/dispense. If omitted, defaults to the corresponding values in "default-values"

anyOf.description: Pick up tip / drop tip / blowout commands
Move to slot command. NOTE: this is an EXPERIMENTAL command, its behavior is subject to change in future releases.

$eref.description: Slot on the deck of an OT-2 robot

___minimum-z-height.description: Optional minimal Z margin in mm. If this is larger than the API's default safe Z margin, it will make the arc higher. If it's smaller, it will have no effect. Specifying this for movements that would not arc (moving within the same well in the same labware) will cause an arc movement instead. This param only supported in API v2, API v1 will ignore it.

___force-direct.description: Default is false. If true, moving from one labware/well to another will not arc to the default safe z, but instead will move directly to the specified location. This will also force the 'minimum-z-height' param to be ignored. In APIv1, this will use strategy='direct', which moves first in X/Y plane and then in Z. In API v2, a 'direct' movement is in X/Y/Z simultaneously

___offset.description: Optional offset from slot bottom left corner, in mm

___wait.description: either a number of seconds to wait (fractional values OK), or `true` to wait indefinitely until the user manually resumes the protocol

$eref.description: Name of a pipette. Does not contain info about specific model/version. Should match keys in pipetteNameSpecs.json file

___.+.description: Fields describing a single labware on the deck

$eref.description: Slot on the deck of an OT-2 robot

___display-name.description: An optional human-readable nickname for this labware. Eg "Buffer Trough"

___model.description: Labware type, eg "96-flat". See http://docs.opentrons.com/containers.html for a full list of supported labware. TODO support custom labware in JSON

___labware.description: The labware used in this protocol, keyed by an arbitrary unique ID

___designer-application.description: Optional data & metadata not required to execute the protocol, used by the application that created this protocol

___application-version.description: Version of the application that created the protocol

___application-name.description: Name of the application that created the protocol. Should be namespaced under the organization or individual who owns the organization, and be kebab-cased, eg "opentrons/protocol-designer"

___data.description: Any data used by the application that created this protocol)

___protocol-schema.description: A version string for the Opentrons JSON Protocol schema being used. "<major>.<minor>.<patch>"

___default-values.$note: TODO: Ian 2018-10-29 make touch-tip-mm-from-top required (breaking change)
___default-values.description: Default values required for protocol execution

___model.description: Model of the robot this (currently only OT-2 Standard is supported)

___description.description: A text description of the protocol. For guidelines about how to write a good description, see (TODO WRITE DOCS & LINK HERE)

___tags.description: Tags to be used in searching for this protocol

___protocol-name.description: A short, human-readable name for the protocol

___author.description: The author or organization who created the protocol

___last-modified.description: UNIX timestamp when this file was last modified

___created.description: UNIX timestamp when this file was created
